channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Small Town Gets an Uncomfortable Spotlight After the Boar’s Head Recall
item.description: A deadly listeria outbreak at the plant in Jarratt, Va., has residents worried about the town’s future.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Grief Mixes With Anger After Recovery of 6 Dead Hostages
item.description: One of the hostages, Hersh Goldberg-Polin, was an American citizen. Israelis lashed out at Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, accusing him of torpedoi...

item.title: With Russia on Its Doorstep, a Ukrainian Town Packs Its Bags
item.description: Ukraine gambled that its move into Russia would draw Moscow’s forces away from the town of Pokrovsk. It didn’t happen. And now resigned residents are ...

item.title: China and the Philippines Collide Again in the South China Sea
item.description: The United States condemned the episode near Sabina Shoal in the South China Sea and reaffirmed its defense treaty with Manila.

item.title: Others Have Politicized Arlington, but Trump’s Approach Has No Precedent
item.description: Donald J. Trump isn’t the first candidate to run afoul of the ban on partisan activity in Arlington National Cemetery. But no one else has responded a...

item.title: Who Are the Biggest Donors to Trump and Harris?
item.description: In presidential politics, campaigns are powered by billionaires. Here is a look at the most influential givers.

item.title: What It’s Like in Egypt as Energy Crisis Prompts Early Shop Closures
item.description: It’s so hot in Cairo that people like to go out all night. It might look like a party, but in reality, one shopkeeper said, “everybody is dead on the ...

item.title: America Must Free Itself from the Tyranny of the Penny
item.description: Few things symbolize our national dysfunction as much as this accursed coin, which we mint by the millions because it’s too worthless to spend.

item.title: In Race Against Polio, Gaza Begins Vaccination Drive
item.description: Israel and Hamas agreed to pause the war to permit the vaccination of 640,000 children in Gaza. It will be a daunting effort for health workers.
